result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Fraud Against Financial Institution (Value Exceeds $500 but does not Exceed $10,000)

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Allessandra M. Sylvesteri

records.addlTxt: Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights (with Attachments)

Cases called at 9:02 AM: 22CF360, 22CF900.
Defendant Allessandra M. Sylvesteri in court with Attorney George E. Miller.  Deputy District Attorney Angela Beranek in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Agreement has been reached. State in compliance with victim notification requirements. Defendant is advised of charges, maximum penalties, elements of the crime(s) and constitutional rights. 
Defendant pleads Guilty to Count 2: Fraud Against Financial Institution (Value Exceeds $500 but does not Exceed $10,000) as part of a 3 Year DAGP. 
DAGP may term after 2 Years if restitution is paid in full and the DAGP Coordinator approves.
Defendant is ordered to complete 60 Hours of Community Service as part of the DAGP. Court withholds finding of guilt.
Charge to be dismissed upon successful completion of the DAGP. 
Remaining charges are dismissed and read in.
Deferred prosecution agreement hearing scheduled for August 19, 2025 at 09:30 am.

10:07 AM case called. Prosecuting attorney Afton Brianna Lewis Ms. in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Allessandra M. Sylvesteri in court.  Attorney George E. Miller in court for Allessandra M. Sylvesteri. Defendant waives right to a preliminary hearing and Court accepts waiver. A plea hearing is scheduled for 8/19/22 at 9:00 AM.

Conditions:
No contact with Westconsin Credit Union

(11:30 AM case called.) Prosecuting attorney Robert W. Stoiber in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Allessandra M. Sylvesteri in court. Attorney George E. Miller in court for Allessandra M. Sylvesteri.
Defendant waives formal reading of the complaint and time limits for preliminary hearing.
Pre-Trial Conference (by phone) with District Attorney's Office (715-839-4828) on June 6, 2022 at 1:15 pm.
Hearing scheduled for June 22, 2022 at 09:30 am.
